text: Rémy Julienne (17 April 1930 – 21 January 2021) was a French stuntman, racecar driver and actor. He was a rallycross champion and 1956 French motorcross champion. He was born in Cepoy, France. He appeared in over 1,400 movies. He was known for being the stuntman on The Italian Job, The Da Vinci Code and six James Bond movies. Julienne died on 21 January 2021 in France from COVID-19, aged 90.Rémy Julienne, l'as des as de la cascade, est mort du Covid-19 à 90 ans 'James Bond' stuntman Remy Julienne dies from coronavirus ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in France Category:French movie actors Category:Stunt performers Category:Racecar drivers
title: Rémy Julienne
